clues.ADAPT: make fit for, or change to suit a new purpose
clues.AGE: an era of history having some distinctive feature
clues.AHEN: Coop inhabitant(s) after a coyote attack, perhaps
clues.ALERT: engaged in or accustomed to close observation
clues.AMAC: What to buy someone with a PC
clues.ANTE: (poker) the initial contribution that each player makes to the pot
clues.ANTHEM: a song of praise (to God or to a saint or to a nation)
clues.APE: represent in or produce a caricature of
clues.BIS: a heavy brittle diamagnetic trivalent metallic element (resembles arsenic and antimony chemically); usually recovered as a by-product from ores of other metals
clues.CAPER: pickled flower buds used as a pungent relish in various dishes and sauces
clues.CHAPEL: a service conducted in a place of worship that has its own altar
clues.CREEK: a natural stream of water smaller than a river (and often a tributary of a river)
clues.DEW: water that has condensed on a cool surface overnight from water vapor in the air
clues.DIN: make a resonant sound, like artillery
clues.DOD: the federal department responsible for safeguarding national security of the United States; created in 1947
clues.EAT: take in food; used of animals only
clues.EDIT: cut and assemble the components of
clues.EGO: an inflated feeling of pride in your superiority to others
clues.ELATE: fill with high spirits; fill with optimism
clues.ELITE: a group or class of persons enjoying superior intellectual or social or economic status
clues.GRAY: American navigator who twice circumnavigated the globe and who discovered the Columbia River (1755-1806)
clues.HEMORROID: Git him a pillow to sit on, misspelled no h
clues.IDAHO: a state in the Rocky Mountains
clues.IDIOPATHY: any disease arising from internal dysfunctions of unknown cause
clues.IDLE: the state of an engine or other mechanism that is idling
clues.INDIGO: a blue dye obtained from plants or made synthetically
clues.LISP: a speech defect that involves pronouncing `s' like voiceless `th' and `z' like voiced `th'
clues.MARS: a mark or flaw that spoils the appearance of something (especially on a person's body)
clues.NEOPLASIA: the pathological process that results in the formation and growth of a tumor
clues.NOEL: period extending from Dec. 24 to Jan. 6
clues.NOSTDS: What you would want to hear when you get tested
clues.OHM: German physicist who formulated Ohm's law (1787-1854)
clues.ONER: being a single entity made by combining separate components
clues.PAIR: a set of two similar things considered as a unit
clues.PAN: express a totally negative opinion of
clues.PROD: a pointed instrument that is used to prod into a state of motion
clues.SAGA: a narrative telling the adventures of a hero or a family; originally (12th to 14th centuries) a story of the families that settled Iceland and their descendants but now any prose narrative that resembles such an account
clues.SEATED: place or attach firmly in or on a base
clues.SNAPAT: What to do to annoying Snapchat selfie takers
clues.STOKE: stir up or tend; of a fire
clues.TEST: a hard outer covering as of some amoebas and sea urchins
clues.YACHT: an expensive vessel propelled by sail or power and used for cruising or racing
clues.YET: despite anything to the contrary (usually following a concession)
